description:
In the early twentieth century, Russo-Japanese War veteran Saichi “Immortal” Sugimoto scratches out a meager existence during the postwar gold rush in the wilderness of Hokkaido. When he stumbles across a map to a fortune in hidden Ainu gold, he sets off on a treacherous quest to find it. But Sugimoto is not the only interested party, and everyone who knows about the gold will kill to possess it! Faced with the harsh conditions of the northern wilderness, ruthless criminals and rogue Japanese soldiers, Sugimoto will need all his skills and luck—and the help of an Ainu girl named Asirpa—to survive.

(Source: Viz Media)

Note: Won the 9th Manga Taisho Award in 2016 and the 22nd Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize in 2018. Nominated for the 20th and 21st Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize and the 40th Kodansha Manga Awards in 2016.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Indigenous Cultures
tags.description: Prominently features real-life indigenous cultures.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Zoophilia
tags.description: Features a character who has a sexual attraction for non-human animals.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Wilderness
tags.description: Predominantly features a location with little to no human activity, such as a deserted island, a jungle, or a snowy mountain range.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

Demon Vice Commander of the Shinsengumi

node.description:
__Current Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Website](https://723000451898910026.weebly.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/satorunoda)

Satoru Noda  is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known as the creator of the manga series [Golden Kamuy](https://anilist.co/manga/86559/Golden-Kamuy/), for which he won the 2016 Manga Taishō and the Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize.

He used to be the assistant of [Yasuyuki Kunitomo](https://anilist.co/staff/114715/Yasuyuki-Kunitomo) and [Mitsurou Kubo](https://anilist.co/staff/96926/Mitsurou-Kubo).
Eugenio Uzhinin is a Russian language teacher, translator and interpreter.

Ōkuma Hakko is the editor of the manga series Golden Kamuy by Noda Satoru, published by Shueisha. Since joining Shueisha in 2008, he has worked in the editorial department of Weekly Young Jump. Okuma was involved in the launch of the ground breaking manga website ‘Tonari no Young Jump’. He is the editor of numerous best-selling manga including the immensely popular One Punch-Man, Himouto! Umaru-chan, Uratarou, Mononogatari, and Akebi-Chan no sailor-fuku.
